page.title: 07Portrait of a Farm(number 2)
page.content: This 2nd farm is smaller, only 112 acres.95 acres are in our block.The farm is devoted entirely to animals.250 sheep are kept.These are known as Mules.This animal produces a good meat lamb.It is bred from a Scottish black- face crossed with Blue-faced Leicester. The sheep are purchased at various mar- kets in the north of England(e.g.Hawes, Lazenby and Castle Douglas.)They are sold at Banbury and Rugby markets. 22 cattle are kept.These are Hereford animals crossed with Friesians.This cross produces a good beef. The land needs an occasional dressing of lime.Fertiliser and farmyard manure is applied annually.The land(in the s.w of our block)has a slight tendency to be deficient in magnesium.
